definition: noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
to cause trouble/to create a disturbance
to enjoy watching a bustling scene/to go where the crowds are
to join in the fun/to get in on the action/(fig.) to butt in/to create more trouble
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to have a falling out/to have a big argument
to disturb/to create confusion/to make a din
to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene

sentences.english: He brought the subject to those who were agitating for a raise in their company.
sentences.chinese: 他把話題轉移到公司裏鬧着要加薪的那幫人身上。

sentences.english: We're finding that businesses who have bedbugs oftentimes will close to remediate the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我們發現，經常鬧臭蟲的企業得歇業來處理這個問題。

sentences.english: Not every idiom translates with such ease.
sentences.chinese: 要鬧清楚每個習慣用語的意思是不容易的。

sentences.english: That way, if we ever break up, I can use it again.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，如果我們鬧崩了，我還可以再用到它。

sentences.english: The footballer kicked at the ball but missed and fell flat on his face.
sentences.chinese: 那個足球運動員要踢球，但沒有踢到，鬧了個嘴啃泥。

sentences.english: Hand in hand, have no quarrel.
sentences.chinese: 他們手拉手，不吵也不鬧。

sentences.english: Ignore the child if he misbehaves, and he'll soon stop.
sentences.chinese: 小孩不乖時，別去理他，不久他就會不鬧了。

sentences.english: Gushan to have turned evil, never to month Begonia trouble.
sentences.chinese: 到得孤山翻作惡，海棠鬧月不曾來。

sentences.english: Every two days, set the alarm for just 10minutes earlier.
sentences.chinese: 每隔兩天，將你的鬧錶往前調個10分鐘。

sentences.english: Tom has been badgering his big brother to buy him a camera.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆一直鬧着他哥哥給他買架照相機。

sentences.english: An early morning alarm gets my daughter, Morgan, up for summer school.
sentences.chinese: 一大早鬧鐘鈴響就鬧醒女兒茉苷去上暑期學校。

sentences.english: The quiet contentment of a well-fed child satisfied the tired mother.
sentences.chinese: 孩子餵飽後不哭不鬧的滿足狀使疲憊的母親很滿意。

sentences.english: Without understanding these cultural differences, one could eventually feel offended.
sentences.chinese: 如果不瞭解這種文化差異的話，有可能鬧得很不愉快。

sentences.english: Comrade still busy, usually with the surface live a day without statehood.
sentences.chinese: 康莉依舊忙碌，平日與鬧鬧過着沒有建國的日子。

sentences.english: There have been too much publicity about their relationship.
sentences.chinese: 他們的關係已經鬧得滿城風雨，人人皆知了。

sentences.english: There is a large collection of jokes about dialogues between a waiter in a restaurant and the customer.
sentences.chinese: 餐館的服務員和顧客在談話中常常鬧出許多笑話。

definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
so much/this much/how much?/this way/like this
to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
